bow: when do you stop putting your kids down for nap what age do stop when they stop falling asleep milk nap time for as long as you possibly can in my experience they will let you know my two year old still takes an afternoon nap my 11 month old takes one morning nap and one afternoon nap but she starting to let me know she is getting ready to drop her afternoon nap she does this by taking *forever* to fall asleep and waking up much earlier than she used to this was how my year old dropped her morning nap eventually it got to the point where she get pissed off if you tried to put her down so we stopped just wish they would have dropped the same nap so could still have some time to myself think it depends on the child mine still has nap in the afternoon and she nearly and half if she does nap she gets over tired and often has night terror it makes no difference to how late she goes to bed whether or not she has nap know other children who stopped napping at my youngest quit napping at my middle at around year but my oldest still naps at 22 years not even joke planning on never when they stop falling asleep they re switching to quiet time went as long as could but we reached point that it meant trouble falling asleep at bedtime we substituted quiet time for naps they just have to do quiet seated activity in low lit room if they want to nap they can that helped halt midday meltdowns while we transitioned mine stopped napping at years just refused made it really hard when she was at daycare and they were doing nap time by age most of her friends were no longer taking naps there are the few though when my little started kindergarten all the kids who still took naps were in the same class that way they could all take nap during the day none of the other kindergarten classes including my daughter took naps none in first grade milk the naps while you can put them down for nap as long as you can there sleep regression basically right at that many stop napping for but if you keep putting them down and let them hang out in their crib bed for that naptime or at least an hour you can get past it and naptime will resume at least that my experience my daughter is little over and still takes hour nap in the afternoon do know what ll do when she stops napping honestly when my oldest was about to turn we never talked about getting to old for naps or anything if she wasn tired she didn nap if she was tired she could nap many days she would just relax for like half an hour mid day and that was eventually it never my year old still takes nap every day my 6yo doesn fall asleep very often but still gets solid hour or two of quiet rest time in bed every day they will let you know my yo still takes nap almost every day he even asks for one lot of days hopefully he adjusts well to school when it just rest time in daycare kids nap until kindergarten my almost year old naps fine at daycare she naps maybe once every other weekend at home that been the case for about year she much more pleasant to be around when she napped yes quiet time is great my daughter just turned three and few months ago it looked like she was done napping but we talked to her about how she still needed quiet time and needed to stay in her room with book and quiet toys would get her after an hour sometimes longer if she was still content for while she would nap about every third day the other days she just played now she is back to napping pretty much every day so glad we didn give up on naps earlier my oldest napped until age we cut it out when it started affecting her sleep at night she would go to sleep until 10pm once we cut the nap out she was back to going to bed at 7pm and sleeping 12 13 hours my youngest stopped napping on his own when he turned he just stopped going to sleep kept trying for months until finally accepted the fact that he was done napping after that we started implementing 30 60 minutes of quiet time in his room instead of nap time when they stop sleeping at night was my clue from my oldest if she naps at all during the day even if it 15 minutes she automatically up till 12 my daughter tried to pretend she was done with nap time for couple of weeks nah dude you ain done my son stopped napping between and he still naps fine at daycare but absolutely refuses at home we tried quiet time but he kept waking up his little sister to play with him then they were both miserable we just gave up and now he stays up while the 18 month old naps he little crabby near bedtime but it way better than the alternative my year old is in pre most of his class had already turned and they still have nap time most kids do sleep but they need to stay quiet and on their cots he officially stopped napping at right when my second was born of course only got glorious double nap also unfortunately he was too loud when we tried to do quiet time and his bedroom shares wall with his brothers so we had to keep him downstairs definitely keep nap time quiet time as looooong as possible mine stopped the week she turned you will know when it time with mine if let her nap from she wouldn go to sleep until 10 her bedtime was 7:30 she just wouldn sleep and be up at 7am which wasn working for me so we dropped the nap and started doing quiet time for hour from instead she just plays in her room so get break and moved bedtime to 6:30pm and she wakes at 7:30pm mines almost now and we have had the above schedule since and it been great also it pretty nice not having to schedule around naps some days we skip quiet time and go before we even hit their normal dinner time because while they do necessarily need nap they could still use one it helps keep their behavior under control they ve gone through periods of not napping but my sil still sends them to take rest when they have to lay quietly in their beds the 5yo is needing less and less time for naps but it still helps keep him from throwing tantrums the 3yo is close
